custom_fields.key_topics:
Through an exploration of the legacy and contributions of key Arab figures from
the 19 th century (Arab Renaissance: "Nahda") to the present day, this course aims
to provide students with a historical overview and understanding of key issues
that continue to engage Arab thought. We will explore how these key Arab figures
impacted narratives, reshaped issues, and effected political, social, economic, and
cultural change that continues to this day. The course will focus on figures from
different domains, including thinkers, writers, poets, politicians, and artists, and
we will study how these figures embodied hopes and aspirations (or not), and
advanced their causes. The course will involve relevant written and audiovisual
materials from different media sources and literary texts (as appropriate).

custom_fields.relevance:
Through the study of key Arab figures, the course aims to provide students with a
historical overview or key events in the Arab region since Nahda to better
understand political, cultural, and social transformation and development, and to
enhance students' knowledge and understanding of issues that currently engage
Arab thought, communities, and cultures within increasingly changing
communities. It aims to help students better understand and appreciate issues
that impact Arab and Arabic-speaking communities not only to better understand
some key events in Arab history and present-day times, but also to develop a
humanistic understanding of issues to enhance intercultural understanding.
